M*reh 30, 1959
Mr. Horace B. Powell
Publications Director
W. K. Kellogg Foundation
250 Champion Street
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Mr. Powelli
Enclosed is the art work for the "pictogram" which we have Just received
back from the artist. You*11 recall that last year we had the pictures of
the listening groups, without the radio tower. Following your suggestion,
after hearing that you were going to feature the NAEB this year, we sent
the original art work back to the artist and asked that a radio tower be
added. I believe the result is about what you had in mind.
I trust that you have found the photos from St. Louis and Chicago which we
sent last year and which our records indicate are still in your office. If
not, perhaps our records are in error and we have lost them. In that event,
if you'll let me know, 1*11 try to secure some other pictures for the story.
If there is anything else you need, please let me know, and we certainly
appreciate the fact that our story will appear in the Foundation report.
Incidentally, I would like to have the enclosed art work back when you are
finally through with it, because I believe it might be used in promotional
brochures to good advantage.
Sincerely,
HEHtJO
Enclosure
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
